answers.answer: According to reports put out by the pathology dept. at John Hopkins, cancer of the pancreas can be a genetic disease - caused by DNA changes (mutations). The changes can be inherited, meaning we're born with them, or they can be acquired, developing after we're born. When the changes are inherited, pancreatic cancer does run in some families. If it's acquired, the DNA changes can be the result of either bad luck during cell replication or by exposure to carcinogens.
